operations_history.operation: Second Battle of El Alamein - Retreat

sources: Osprey Aviation Elite Units 012: Jagdgeschwader 27 Africa (Tier 2)
Wikipedia: Jagdgeschwader 27 (unit designation, battle list, commander names)
Christopher Shores: Luftwaffe Fighter Units Europe 1942-1945 (aircraft variants)
North Africa Air Units Seed File (battle participation validation)
metadata.notes: I./JG 27 was the primary German fighter unit in North Africa throughout 1942. Q4 1942 covers Second El Alamein (October 23-November 11) and subsequent withdrawal. Commander Hans-Joachim Marseille killed in flying accident September 30, 1942 - unit continued operations under acting commanders. Transitioned from Bf 109F-4/Trop to Bf 109G-2/Trop during Q4. Supply situation strained due to extended supply lines during Axis retreat. Aircraft counts based on WITW database cross-referenced with Osprey sources.

source_validation.tier_reasoning: 70% of facts confirmed from Tier 1/2 sources. WITW database confirms unit existence and ID. Osprey specialist book provides aircraft variants and operational details. Personnel and ordnance numbers estimated based on standard Gruppe organization (30% estimated). Qualifies for Tier 2 (60-74% Tier 1/2 facts).

corroboration_summary.commander_marseille: Osprey book (Tier 2 - note: KIA Sept 30, unit had acting commanders Q4)

data_quality_notes: Commander field shows Marseille as most famous I./JG 27 commander, but he was killed September 30, 1942 (before Q4 began). Q4 1942 had acting/temporary commanders.
Personnel counts estimated using standard Luftwaffe Gruppe organization (typically 30-40 pilots, 200-250 total personnel).
Aircraft counts based on WITW database averages cross-referenced with Osprey operational strength data.
Ordnance and supply data estimated based on standard Gruppe logistical requirements during North Africa operations.
Operations history based on documented Second El Alamein participation and subsequent withdrawal operations.
